channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11819] Unit test for CoprocessorHConnection
item.description: Add a unit test to hbase-server that exercises CoprocessorHConnection .

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment:
Hi Andrew Purtell,

I want to do the issue. Can you explain little bit more ? What kind of tests Test Class should has ?

Hi Talat UYARER, you would want to do something like:

  • Create a new Medium test.
  • Make a mocked coprocessor for the test. Have a look at some of the existing coprocessor unit tests for code examples. This coprocessor should have a test method that uses CoprocessorHConnection to connect to the test table and do a get from the region hosted locally.
  • Initialize the minicluster with 3 slaves.
  • Create a table with some data in it that has at least 3 regions, register the mocked coprocessor as a table coprocessor on this table.
  • Verify the table regions are all assigned to different regionservers.
  • Use the HBaseTestingUtility to get a handle to one regionserver. Get its coprocessor host and look up the coprocessor instance running there. Your coprocessor will know what region it is running on. You can get it using RegionCoprocessorEnvironment#getRegion. This will return a HRegion object. Use HRegion#getStartKey to find the start key for this region.
  • Invoke the test method of your coprocessor instance, passing the start key for the region. The test method should use this start key for a Get on the CoprocessorHConnection. Confirm that some data was actually returned.

The above would test for the bugfix on HBASE-11766.

I think we would also want an additional unit test that confirms the short circuit path was taken, but that would be more difficult to achieve so does not have to be done in the context of this issue.

Actually you only need to create a minicluster with 1 slave and a table with 1 region to check for the fix on HBASE-11766. We wouldn't need more slaves/regions until attempting that last part I mentioned, confirmation that the short circuit path was taken.

Hi Andrew Purtell,

I create a test with your instruction. Could you review my patch ?

You create an admin. In future, close it inside a try/finally rather than just when you are done.

+ Admin admin = util.getHBaseAdmin();
....
+ admin.createTable(htd, new byte[][]

{ rowSeperator1, rowSeperator2 });
+ util.waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned(testTable);
+ admin.close();


Instead do...

+ Admin admin = util.getHBaseAdmin();
try {
+ admin.createTable(htd, new byte[][] { rowSeperator1, rowSeperator2 }

);
+ util.waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned(testTable);
} finally {
admin.close...

Just FYI.

Same with HTable.

See how the way you are making HTable is now deprecated? Avoid doing it the way you have it if you can.

Otherwise patch looks good to me.

Good for you Andrew Purtell?
Yes, lgtm, with Stack's suggestions.
it was updated through Stack's suggestions

See style that is in the rest of the code base Talat UYARER See where we put spacings or, better, install the eclipse style plugin. See '18.3.1.1. Code Formatting' in refguide. For example, see how we do the spacing around ' }finally{' elsewhere in code base... There is a space after and before parens....

This is good:

+ try{
+ // Create a table with 3 region
+ admin.createTable(htd, new byte[][]

{ rowSeperator1, rowSeperator2 }

);
+ util.waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned(testTable);
+ }finally

{ + admin.close(); + }

... except, look up in the method and you'll see that admin is used doing table exists and disable, etc. What if admin throws exception in these methods?

Almost there.
Hi stack, Sorry for code formatting. My eclipse's setting was broken. Now I fix it.

Applied to branch-1+. Thanks for the patch Talat UYARER What I applied differed in the formatting. I removed white space too. See d719ea1db795686f893cba8ad85d16b3e136e89b and compare to what you posted so you know for next time. Good on you.

I appreciate that it wasn't (yet) committed to 0.98 since it looks like there is an issue with the stability of the test but I'm wondering why the fix version for 0.98 was removed from this issue. I can see that in the JIRA history. Yet I had that fix version set on purpose and there's no reason this could not have been committed to 0.98. So let me again repeat my request that committers not ignore branch 0.98. Thanks.
Andrew Purtell I tried and there was a bunch of fixup needed. I suppose I could ask Talat UYARER do it.
Or at least don't drop the fix version, and leave the issue open.

Hi stack,

I check my patch again. I run two times all tests. I can not get any error about Test case. In your opinion What does reason of this problem ?

Andrew Purtell I will can create patch for 0.98 version

Talat UYARER, a run of your test from build #395 on the master branch failed with the following stack trace:


java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Row length is 0

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Mutation.checkRow(Mutation.java:508)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Mutation.checkRow(Mutation.java:492)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Get.<init>(Get.java:91)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestCoprocessorHConnection.testHConnection(TestCoprocessorHConnection.java:149)

Thanks Dima Spivak
I found the bug. Test always takes first key from regions. When the region is first region, its start key comes as blank . Test try to get blank string as row key. With these patches, I fixed it

Andrew Purtell, I have some 0.98 build error. When I fix it, I will send a patch to 0.98

Latest precommit looks good. Running a few iterations of the 0.98 version of the new test locally before commit.

After 25 iterations it looks good.

Last round of feedback from me. Here:


+    public Result getOnCoprocessorHConnection(TableName tableName, byte[] key)

+        throws IOException {

+      conn = CoprocessorHConnection.getConnectionForEnvironment(env);

+      Table hTable = conn.getTable(tableName);

+      Get get = new Get(key);

+      Result result = hTable.get(get);

+      return result;

+    }

two issues:

  1. Why are we using a class field instead of a local variable ('conn')? Let's not.
  2. Add an assertion that the Connection returned by CoprocessorHConnection#getConnectionForEnvironment is the expected type. A test for instanceof CoprocessorHConnection should evaluate to true

0.98 version needs the same changes.
Thanks Andrew Purtell for reviewing. I updated last issues and I created new file for master branch. May you check it ? If it looks ok, I will create for other branches.
+1, thanks

Talat UYARER Some feedback on your patch.

It is 2 spaces, not 4 spaces when you tab over.

Statics are traditionally upper cased so instead of:

private static HBaseTestingUtility util = new HBaseTestingUtility();

you'd write

private static HBaseTestingUtility UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility();

There are a few cases of the above. Check for them.

No harm putting a class comment on the test saying what it is testing?

Is this good....

115 } finally

{ 116 admin.close(); 117 }

... you are getting the Admin from UTIL and then closing the Admin even though you didn't create it....

Don't add commented out code. Just remove it:

119 //Get Table
120 //HTable table = new HTable(util.getConfiguration(), testTable);

Be careful with your formatting:

try{

Also, rather than:

121 Table table = util.getConnection().getTable(testTable);
122

... you could write:

try (Table table = util.getConnection().getTable(testTable)) {
....

then no need of the finally clause (see https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html )

Above are mostly nits but you are going to be around for the summer at least so lets get the little stuff right too... Thanks Talat UYARER
Changed fix versions to be 1.3+. Removed 1.2.x and lesser versions.
